titleStmt.title: Despatch from Theodore A. Rosenbush to J. C. Bancroft Davis, July 24, 1869

bibl.title: Despatch from Theodore A. Rosenbush to J. C. Bancroft Davis
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

correspAction.persName: Davis, J. C. Bancroft (John Chandler Bancroft), 1822-1907

div1.p: Commercial Agency of the United States of America at Sierra Leone 24th July 1869.
I have to report to the Department the death of John C. Berry a citizen of Boston, Mass: and late Master of the American Brig "Ann Elizabeth" of Salem, Mass:, which took place on the 13th instant.
I have taken an Inventory of the deceased's effects, which accompanies them by the same Brig.

I have placed Mr John Havlin, the
H. B. Davis Esqre
Assistant Secretary
Washington, D.C.
the first Officer, in command of the "Ann Elizabeth".

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient Servant
Rosenbush.
U.S. Vice Comml: Agt:
